1.brief: to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

3.brief: to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

4.brief: properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

5.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
near, with or among; often in general, to
to sparkle, i.e. (figuratively) be cheerful; hence (from the sheen of a running stream) to flow, i.e. (figuratively) assemble
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach

6.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

7.brief: properly, to incline; by implication, to decline (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to pitch atent; gen. to encamp (for abode or siege)
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen

8.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in

9.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

10.brief: a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

11.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)

12.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

13.brief: to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

14.brief: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)

15.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
near, with or among; often in general, to

16.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration

17.brief: to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

18.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

19.brief: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

20.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

21.brief: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish

22.brief: to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
